document_data.name: Gryznath
document_data.deathnotes: Allegedly killed by a group of [[adventurer]]s{{Cite dungeon/221/Vainglorious|32, 39}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Gryznath''' was an adult [[black dragon]] and a [[Chosen]] of [[Null|Faluzure]] who lived in the [[High Moor]] near the theocracy of [[Elturgard]], around [[1480 DR]].{{Cite dungeon/221/Vainglorious|29}}<ref group="note">Although there is not an exact date given, this adventure takes place six months after the start of a 4{{th}}-edition campaign ([[Shieldmeet]] of [[1479 DR]]).
document_data.Personality: Gryznath was highly intelligent for a black dragon, but he was also vainglorious.
document_data.Lair: Gryznath laired in the ruins of an old keep whose history was lost to time,{{Cite dungeon/221/Vainglorious|33}}
document_data.History:
Around 1480 DR, Gryznath was sent by his god to take control of an [[orc]] horde and to topple the theocracy of Elturgard. Gryznath took the chance to try to convert his orc army to the worship of Faluzure. 

During his first attacks on [[Elturel]], Gryznath killed the [[Torm]]ite [[paladin]] Sir [[Tavil Soarvaren]], and reanimated him as an [[undead]] to take control of ''[[Loyalty's Sacrifice]]'', a holy [[artifact]] of Torm.

Eventually, the leaders of the [[Knights of Fury]] sent a group of [[adventurer]]s to deal with the dragon.{{Cite dungeon/221/Vainglorious|28-29}} Although the adventurers claimed to have killed him, the paladins later investigated Gryznath's lair and didn't find his corpse. Some theorized that the corpse was either retrieved by a third party for unknown purposes, or that Gryznath was resurrected as an undead by his god, Faluzure.
